meanings.definition: A person who adheres strictly to a set of rules or principles.
meanings.sent1: The rigorists in the group always followed the rules to the letter.
meanings.sent2: The school's rigorists insisted on everyone wearing the proper uniform.
meanings.sent3: The rigorists at the party made sure no one broke the game rules.
meanings.sent4: She was a rigorist when it came to following her daily schedule.
meanings.sent5: The rigorists' dedication to the guidelines was truly admirable.

meanings.definition: Those who demand strict adherence to rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: The rigorists in the committee pushed for stricter regulations.
meanings.sent2: The company's rigorists were always monitoring employee conduct.
meanings.sent3: The rigorists at the event insisted on punctuality above all else.
meanings.sent4: He was known as a rigorist for his unwavering commitment to quality.
meanings.sent5: The rigorists' insistence on perfection sometimes caused tension.
